Articles.Content:
KSP Ver: 0.9 32 bit

What happend: SPH dont function in a specific save, it cant launch or load ships, it does nothing.

In a fresh save it works.

Save attacked:

[https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6bpkLLF0N9VVGZxT002Z21YU2s&authuser=0](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6bpkLLF0N9VVGZxT002Z21YU2s&authuser=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-05T18:43:34Z" title="03/05/2015 06:43  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 5, 2015</time> by Claw**

Looks like you've got a corrupted craft file in your Ships\SPH folder. Also, we can't view that file with your current privacy settings. 

Anyway, to fix this, just move all your .craft files out of the Ships\SPH folder, then try to create a simple craft and reload it to confirm that the SPH does in fact work again. Then, start putting the craft files you took out back in, one at a time, testing the Load button each time. When it stops working, you've found the broken file. There's not much you'll be able to do other than deleting it, I'm afraid. Broken files that cause this kind of error are typically missing just about everything, so rebuilding from scratch is more or less the only option there is, unfortunately.
Alright, but when doing this do I have to fully close ksp or just click on load?

You can freely move the .craft files around, and try clicking on Load in between. No need to restart KSP while doing so.

You can also bring up the MOD+F2 debug log (ALT+F2 in Windows). If it's a corrupt craft file, the log will often tell you.

Cheers,

~Claw
Haha, I've found the problem the folder SPH was missing.
